PINELLIA TERNATA: Overview, Uses, Side Effects, Precautions, Interactions, Dosing and Reviews
s: Since April 2004, pinellia ternata has been banned in the US because it contains chemicals called ephedrine alkaloids. These chemicals might cause serious side effects such as heart attack, stroke, or seizures. The ban does not apply to traditional Asian medicines containing this ingredient.

t: AHPA seeks ‘correction’ from FDA on ephedrine alkaloids letter
s: August 24, 2023 - Amazon said the FDA ruling precluded it from selling the product containing Pinellia ternata, and it asked whether the brand had any test results to show the absence of ephedrine alkaloids in the Pinellia ternata used to manufacture the product.

The genus Pinellia (Araceae) is mainly distributed in Eastern Asia (China, Japan and Korea), and comprises the following nine species: Pinellia tripartita (Blume) Schott, Pinellia pedatisecta Schott, Pinellia integrifolia N. E. Brown, Pinellia ternata (Thunb.) Breit., Pinellia cordata N.
